title: KP is England’s scapegoat - Flintoff
description: Former England all-rounder Andrew Flintoff believes that Kevin Pietersen has been made a scapegoat for England's Ashes whitewash.

title: It’s Hendricks v Miller in Twenty20 final
description: Beuran Hendricks and David Miller go into the Ram Slam T20 final as the stand out players for their respective franchises.

title: Can Baxter lead Chiefs to glory?
description: Stuart Baxter will be expected to take Kaizer Chiefs to the promised land in this season's African Champions League.

title: Watson blow for Aussies
description: Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has been ruled out of the first Test against South Africa.

title: Dolphins need to end era of mediocrity
description: The last time the Dolphins lifted a trophy was in the 2005/2006 season, when current coach Lance Klusener was their captain.

title: NZ beat Blitzbokke to take Wellington title
description: New Zealand outblitzed the Blitzbokke to regain the lead in the IRB World Sevens series, defeating the South Africans 21-0 in the Wellington final.

title: United must finish strongly - Fletcher
description: Manchester United midfielder Darren Fletcher admits it is imperative his side finish the season strongly as the misfiring champions prepare to host struggling Fulham at Old Trafford.

title: Bolt delays Commonwealth decision
description: World record-holder Usain Bolt will not decide until the Jamaican championships in June whether or not he will compete in the Commonwealth Games a month later.

title: Australia takes charge of Fed Cup tie
description: Australia took a firm grip on their Fed Cup first round tie against a young and inexperienced Russian team Saturday, racing to an easy 2-0 lead.

title: Jose happy to play mind games
description: Jose Mourinho is happy to play mind games with Chelsea's title rivals because he believes it can help his side win the Premier League.

title: ICC board passes controversial revamp
description: The International Cricket Council board approved wide-ranging structural and governance reforms despite widespread condemnation.

title: Serena withdraws from Indian Wells
description: World number one Serena Williams has withdrawn from next month's  WTA tournament at Indian Wells, an event which she entered last month after boycotting it since 2001.

title: India chasing big target
description: New Zealand seized control of the first Test against India and then proceeded to let go in a frenetic third day Saturday which saw  17 wickets fall.
